cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi (105 km) SSW of Great Inagua Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: expected to track WNW across the southeastern Bahamas today, skirt or cross eastern-central Cuba Friday, then turn northwest toward the Florida Keys Saturday and the northeastern Gulf of Mexico with an eventual landfall along the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast – most likely the Florida Panhandle/Alabama coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch – Haiti (northern coast), southeastern Bahamas, and the Cuban provinces of Ciego de Ávila eastward to Guantánamo
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Bahamas, north coast of Cuba, Florida Keys and southern Florida today-Saturday, then northern Gulf Coast Sunday-Monday
weather_observation.wind: Brief squalls with gusts possibly nearing tropical-storm force (≤ 39 mph) late Sunday into Monday; overall probability low (<10 %)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side because center remains in the Gulf of Mexico
weather_observation.rainfall: 3-5 inches of rain possible Sunday-Monday with pockets of 4+ inches leading to localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated thunderstorms, lightning, and reduced visibility in heavy rain bands that could disrupt cargo handling and vessel movements
